title: Hello, I’m Jin Kang
text:
An aspiring Developer and Engineer.
Passionate about AI, LLMs, and NLP.
I’m a Applied Artificial Intelligence passionate about building and innovative solutions that positively impact the world. With a passion for machine learning and software development, I aim to contribute to cutting-edge technologies that address complex challenges.

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
GenAI has definitely helped me out a lot. From University, to my workplace at SIT x NVIDIA AI Center. I have used it to generate code, debug, and even brainstorm ideas. I have also used it to help me with my Quarto website for this portfolio.



I chose ChatGPT because of its versatility, ease of use, and its ability to generate coherent and structured responses almost instantly. It was readily accessible through a web interface, and I could ask it questions, test ideas, and request help in clarifying technical concepts.




Throughout my assessment, ChatGPT helped me in various ways:

Clarifying technical concepts – For example, I was confused about how grid layouts work in Quarto. ChatGPT explained the .grid cols=2 syntax and helped me debug my .qmd structure.
Improving Markdown formatting – It helped me clean up and restructure my pages so that the website layout was visually clearer and more responsive.
Suggesting content – When I didn’t know how to start writing my personal introduction or project descriptions, ChatGPT provided sample content that I could modify and personalize.






Efficiency: I could quickly brainstorm ideas or troubleshoot issues without waiting for external help.
24/7 Availability: I could work late at night or during weekends and still have reliable assistance.
Structured Support: Instead of generic search results, ChatGPT gave me context-aware answers that often directly solved my problem.






Accuracy concerns: Sometimes the information sounded correct but wasn’t entirely accurate — especially for very specific technical issues.
Over-reliance: I found myself tempted to ask ChatGPT before trying things out myself, which can affect independent problem-solving.
Formatting limitations: In some cases, the response formatting would break in RStudio Visual mode, so I had to manually fix it.





I believe GenAI tools like ChatGPT will play a significant role in both my academic and professional future:

In university, I can use it to refine code, debug Markdown, summarize research papers, and brainstorm ideas for projects.
In industry, I see GenAI as a productivity enhancer — useful for writing documentation, reviewing code, or generating boilerplate for new systems.





Overall, using GenAI for this assessment made me realize how valuable this technology can be — not as a replacement for learning, but as a learning companion. When used responsibly, it enhances creativity, accelerates development, and empowers users to achieve more.

“Generative AI doesn’t replace thinking — it extends it.”
